Package interactions

Class UserMenu

java.lang.Object
interactions.Interaction
interactions.UserMenu
Direct Known Subclasses:
queryAllCampsMenu, queryAllEnquiriesMenu, queryAllSuggestionsMenu, queryCampsFilteredMenu, queryFilterCampByMenu, queryOwnCampsMenu, queryOwnEnquriesMenu, queryOwnSuggestionsMenu, StaticMenu
public abstract class UserMenu extends Interaction
An interaction that when run, displays a menu to the user. Contains a list of choices that make up the menu and some auxiliary functions to allow behaviour customisation.

  • Field Details

    • choices

      protected List<MenuChoice> choices
      A list of menu choices to be run. This has to be populated before any choices can be given, and on run() all menus first populate this choices before taking any other action.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserMenu

      public UserMenu()

  • Method Details

    • givechoices

      protected final int givechoices() throws UserInfoMissingException
      Offers users whatever choice exists in choices, + back, which causes this interaction to return to its previous caller.

      Only shows the choices users have permission to see.

      Returns:
      the index in choices corresponding to the choice the user picked
      Throws:
      UserInfoMissingException - if the current user does not have a valid id.

    • checkandrun

      protected final void checkandrun(int choice) throws UserInfoMissingException, MissingRequestedDataException
      Checks to see if the user's choice is valid, and calls the chosen Interaction.
      Parameters:
      choice -
      Throws:
      UserInfoMissingException - if the Interaction to be ran threw it on running.
      MissingRequestedDataException - if the Interaction to be ran threw it on running.

    • run

      protected abstract Object run() throws UserInfoMissingException, MissingRequestedDataException
      For all menus, the run sequence is as follow:

      1. Initialise and get ready any data needed to populate choices.

      2. Populate choices.

      3. Give choices.

      4. Based on what the user picked, set tags and data as necessary as user input may affect subsequent Interactions ran.

      5. check and run the chosen Interaction.

      6. Upon chosen Interaction's return, clear tags and data as necessary to give parent Interactions a clean slate if necessary.

      7. Return to parent Interaction (if any, else return to main()).

      Specified by:
      run in class Interaction
      Returns:
      the result of the run
      Throws:
      UserInfoMissingException - if ran Interaction threw it
      MissingRequestedDataException - if ran Interaction threw it
